definition: chip (in gambling)/token (for counting)/ticket/to prepare/to plan/to raise (funds)/resource/means
weight/number/code/to pile/to stack/classifier for length or distance (yard), happenings etc

sentences.english: Both arms folded and he'd push most of his chips into the betting circle.
sentences.chinese: 兩臂摺疊起來告訴他應該把大部分的籌碼都押上。

sentences.english: A fifth bargaining chip could be to alter the schedule of payments.
sentences.chinese: 第五個可以用來議價的籌碼是改變原訂的付款日期。

sentences.english: Lin Lei saw the opportunity to ridicule Bai righteousness, want him to hold.
sentences.chinese: 林磊看準機會乘機奚落柏義，要他來執籌碼。

sentences.english: He went inside and tried to buy chips to play blackjack.
sentences.chinese: 他進到裏面試圖要買籌碼來玩黑傑克。

sentences.english: When the card game ended, he cashed in his chips and left the gambling house.
sentences.chinese: 牌局結束後，他把籌碼兌換成現金離開賭場。

sentences.english: On the execution ground, gowardesh chip finally won the vitality for the treasure.
sentences.chinese: 刑場上，狗娃以寶藏爲籌碼終於獲得了生機。

sentences.english: He will turn in his chips in exchange for money or cash.
sentences.chinese: 他會將自己的chips籌碼兌換成錢或現金。

sentences.english: The stranger shoved in all his chips and followed with the deed to his plantation.
sentences.chinese: 陌生人把所有的籌碼全部押上，外加那個農場的文契。

sentences.english: Under you the gambling stake, the checkup gambling house, blusters , even enhances the chip.
sentences.chinese: 你下賭注，覈對牌局，虛張聲勢，甚至提高籌碼。

sentences.english: The game is made by the blood and life of the chip, you dare to play?
sentences.chinese: 這場遊戲是用鮮血和生命的作籌碼的，你敢玩嗎？

sentences.english: Imagine for a moment that your self-esteem is like a stack of poker chips.
sentences.chinese: 試着把你的自信心想象成一堆籌碼。

sentences.english: Write a program to solve the problem with 4 counters schematically.
sentences.chinese: 寫一個程序示意性地解決四個籌碼轉移的問題。

sentences.english: In the meantime, this also can be helped and dispatch wins more chip to appear on the market.
sentences.chinese: 同時，這也能幫助和訊爲上市贏得更多的籌碼。

sentences.english: And Chicago's not budging from its stance of not including Noah in a deal for Anthony.
sentences.chinese: 而芝加哥，他們似乎也堅決不肯把諾阿當做交易籌碼。

sentences.english: The Los Angeles Lakers have offered a future first-round pick to Minnesota for completing the transaction.
sentences.chinese: 湖人隊同森林狼交易的籌碼是未來的一個首輪選秀權。

sentences.english: Before this season conclusion, the bibby will become the very good transaction chip.
sentences.chinese: 在本賽季結束之前，畢比都將成爲很好的交易籌碼。

definition: paper money/a bill (e.g. 100 yuan)/CL:張|张[zhang1],紮|扎[za1]
to borrow or lend money/debit and credit items on a balance sheet
to convert (an asset) into cash/to cash out
